chargeHist.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Charles E. Isham was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility
Answer to demand for discovery and inspection

records.addlTxt: 11:16 AM Defendant Charles E. Isham appeared by video, in custody. Attorney Elizabeth F Svehlek appeared by video for Charles E. Isham. Attorney Mary M Sowinski in court for State of Wisconsin. Calling 21CF341 & 22CF169. Today's hearing is for preliminary hearing in 22CF169. Svehlek statement-defendant stipulates to probable cause. Court finds waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that probable cause exists and binds over. Sowinski notes Information will mirror complaint. Svehlek willing to proceed to arraignment; defendant pleads not guilty. State to file Information by end of day tomorrow. Court notes this is a Branch I case; waiting for appointment. Counsel to contact Br. 1 for further scheduling. Svehlek notes defendant's probation hold has been dropped; requests bond modification to signature bond. Sowinski statement-objects. Court statement-denies bond reduction. If resolution reached prior to Br. 1 appointment/start date, counsel may contact Judge Bloom for scheduling. Bond continued. adj. 11:25 a.m.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
1:58 PM Prosecuting attorney Mary M Sowinski Ms. in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Charles E. Isham appeared by video, in custody. Attorney Elizabeth Svehlek appearing by video. Calling 21cf341 & 22CF169. 22CF169 set for a preliminary hearing. In receipt of complaint, waive reading - set for preliminary hearing. Svehlek states Defendant is on a probation hold. Sowinski/Svehlek/Defendant statement to bond. Defendant states probation hold has been lifted - starting online schooling. Court sets bond. adj. 02:10 PM
Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 2, 2022 at 11:15 am.
